intro: Hieracium peracutum, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers appear in late summer, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium peracutum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
